page.title: 16HERONBANK FARM, BERKSWELL
page.content: At Heronbank Farm eggs are produced by battery farming. 5 laying houses contain 2000 chickens in each, with 50 in each cage, all having been vaccinated against disease. The amount of daylight and the temperature of 90F is crucial to the rearing of the chickens, which eat 8 tons of mash and drink 917 gallons of water per year. One chicken lays 270 eggs a year. The eggs are collected, taken to the grading house, carefully inspected, graded by machine according to E.E.C. regulations, then packed by hand. There has been controversy over this farm recently because of the chicken manure. The sheds are cleaned out weekly and 7 to 8 tons of manure is removed every year. This is spread over the surrounding land so there are often complaints from neighbours about the smell, especially in warm weather.
